summary:
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

Class Autotools: likely a wrapper for building software using GNU Autotools (autoreconf, configure, make, install). Also includes helper for Windows MinGW.

So summary: Provides utilities to automate the Autotools build process (running autoreconf, configure, make, install) and handling Windows MinGW environment.

Business intent: Facilitate building and installing software packages that use Autotools, simplifying integration in CI/CD or deployment pipelines.

Keywords: autotools, build automation, configure, make, install, autoreconf, mingw, windows, compilation, packaging.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim? The constraint: Do NOT list method names verbatim. So we shouldn't include "autoreconf", "configure", "make", "install", "_use_win_mingw". But we can refer to them generically: "run autoreconf", etc? Might be okay but better avoid exact method names. Use generic terms: "regenerate build scripts", "configure build", "compile source", "install binaries", "handle MinGW on Windows". Those are not verbatim method names? They contain same words but not exact method names? Might be okay.

Let's craft summary: "A utility class that orchestrates the typical Autotools workflow—regenerating configuration scripts, configuring the source tree, compiling, and installing—while also providing support for MinGW environments on Windows."

Business intent: "To streamline the build and deployment of software that relies on the GNU Autotools suite, enabling automated, cross‑platform compilation and installation within development pipelines."

Keywords list: ["autotools", "build automation", "configure scripts", "compilation", "installation", "mingw", "windows support", "software packaging", "continuous integration"]

Make sure JSON format with double quotes.

Return only JSON.
